channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

Report E-2024030448

item.title: Report X-2024030789
item.description:
Report X-2024030789

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found leaking and was brought over to damages area. DescribePack: There was a loose cap on 1 bottle and it leaked half it's contents into the shipping box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The lid was tightend and It was put in a plastic hazmat bag and tote and brought to the hazmat cage and put under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2024030762
item.description:
Report X-2024030762

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This was found on a drivers truck when attempting delivery. This was then placed inside a garbage sack till the driver returned to the station which it was then placed inside a hazmat bin and placed inside our hazmat cage till the next day when someone could take care of it. DescribePack: All of the caps were cracked as if this was dropped upside down and left that way for a time since a portion of the liquid was inside the bags that each container was in. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: This was placed rightside up so nothing else would leak, then placed inside a hazmat bin when the driver returned.

item.title: Report X-2024030607
item.description:
Report X-2024030607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/14/2024 at approximately 2158, Dangerous Goods Administation received a call from Employee 240946 at a station location in Spokane, reporting an undeclared deisel spill. The shipment consists of what appears to be a diesel fuel pump containing fuel residue. The shipment was discovered leaking during sort. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, being void of the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024030667
item.description:
Report X-2024030667

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PLASTIC JERRICAN WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND JERRICAN WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. JERRICAN WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND JERRICAN WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2024030006
item.description:
Report X-2024030006

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: PROSSER
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Tank Car SHPX 224090 found releasing propane from a slightly open liquid line valve and loose plug also found on same liquid line. BNSF HMERT personnel closed the valve and scurred the vale to stop the release.
